attributes.action: Reform the family courts to support shared parenting and equality.
attributes.additional_details: We are now nearing the end of the second decade of the 21st century and nothing has changed within the law, yet father’s are far more active in the raising of our children.
attributes.background:
The keynote speech from Lord Justice MacFarlane highlighted issues with the current family court’s procedure. 

The current children’s act was introduced in 1989 and based on 1980’s lifestyle.

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do to reform family courts.
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You might want to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/257930
